result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kathy Lynn Nowakowski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kathy Lynn Nowakowski not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Kathy Lynn Nowakowski.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests a date for plea and sentencing.  Court accepts misdemeanor cases from Branch 1 for global resolution.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report - 09-20-2022

Defendant Kathy Lynn Nowakowski not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Kathy Lynn Nowakowski.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Parties are pursuing global resolution; Court will accept defendants other cases for resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Pretrial Services Violation Report
new criminal charges

Defendant Kathy Lynn Nowakowski in court by video with Attorney Michael B Plaisted who appears in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kathy Lynn Nowakowski in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel. Court appoints attorney Plaisted, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $25.00 per month beginning 10-15-2022, and then the 15th of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kathy Lynn Nowakowski in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPER BY VIDEO  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02. According to SPD she's not eligible for services, has county appointment for other cases. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.   No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Kathy Lynn Nowakowski in court with Student Intern Ryan Birschbach under the supervision of attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz. Defendant Kathy Lynn Nowakowski in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kathy Lynn Nowakowski appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
